Class BranchAndBound

java.lang.Object
com.pld.agile.model.algorithm.bnb.BranchAndBound
public class BranchAndBound extends Object
The BranchAndBound class implements a branch and bound algorithm to solve the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP). It finds the shortest path visiting all nodes in a given cost matrix and returns to the starting node, minimizing the total distance.

      public BranchAndBound()

  • Method Details

    • findBestCost

      public void findBestCost()
      Starts the process of finding the best cost and path using the branch and bound algorithm. This method initiates the permutation process, aiming to find the shortest path visiting all nodes and returning to the starting point.

    • permut

      private void permut(int[] visited, int nbVisited, int[] notVisited, int nbNotVisited, double distance)
      Recursive method that generates permutations of the visited nodes and calculates the distance traveled. It eliminates paths that exceed the current best distance and checks for intersection to ensure no crossing edges.It also reorders the ramaining nodes to visit the nearest ones first.
      Parameters:
      visited - the list of already visited nodes
      nbVisited - the number of visited nodes
      notVisited - the list of unvisited nodes
      nbNotVisited - the number of unvisited nodes
      distance - the current total distance traveled

    • edgesIntersect

      private boolean edgesIntersect(int i, int iNext, int j, int jNext)
      Checks if the edges formed by two pairs of nodes intersect, i.e., whether they cross each other in the path. This ensures that paths remain non-intersecting.
      Parameters:
      i - the first node of the first edge
      iNext - the second node of the first edge
      j - the first node of the second edge
      jNext - the second node of the second edge
      Returns:
      true if the edges intersect, false otherwise

    • containIntersection

      private boolean containIntersection(int nbVisited, int lastVisited, int nextNode, int[] visited)
      Checks if adding the next node will create any intersections with previously visited edges. It compares the new edge formed with all previously visited edges.
      Parameters:
      nbVisited - the number of nodes visited so far
      lastVisited - the last node visited
      nextNode - the next node to visit
      visited - the array of visited nodes
      Returns:
      true if an intersection is found, false otherwise

    • updateTables

      private void updateTables(int[] visited, int nbVisited, int[] notVisited, int nbNotVisited, int nextNode, int i)
      Updates the visited and notVisited arrays by marking the next node as visited and swapping it with the last unvisited node in the notVisited array.
      Parameters:
      visited - the array of visited nodes
      nbVisited - the number of visited nodes
      notVisited - the array of notVisited nodes
      nbNotVisited - the number of unvisited nodes
      nextNode - the next node to visit
      i - the index of nextNode in notVisited array

    • restoreTables

      private void restoreTables(int[] notVisited, int nbNotVisited, int nextNode, int i)
      Restores the notVisited array by swapping the last unvisited node back to its original position after the recursive call.
      Parameters:
      notVisited - the array of unvisited nodes
      nbNotVisited - the number of unvisited nodes
      nextNode - the next node that was visited
      i - the index of nextNode in notVisited array

    • findIndex

      private int findIndex(int[] array, int value, int length)
      Finds the index of a specific value in an array up to the given length.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to search
      value - the value to find
      length - the length of the array to consider
      Returns:
      the index of the value in the array, or -1 if not found

    • getCostsMatrix

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Double>> getCostsMatrix()
      Returns the cost matrix used by the algorithm.
      Returns:
      the cost matrix

      public void setCostsMatrix(ArrayList<ArrayList<Double>> costsMatrix)
      Sets the cost matrix for the algorithm.
      Parameters:
      costsMatrix - the cost matrix to set

      public long getNbCalls()

      Parameters:
      nbCalls - the number of calls to set

    • getBestPath

      public List<Integer> getBestPath()

      Returns:
